alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 2:11AM EST until February 05 at 10:52PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Georgia... Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Columbus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 28 feet, Minor flooding continues along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the 14th Street bridge. Portions of the River Walk in Columbus will be flooded around one foot deep and closed to the public. The Phenix City Amphitheater on the Alabama side will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CST Saturday /2:00 AM EST Saturday/ the stage was 27.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM CST Saturday /2:00 AM EST Saturday/ was 31.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 28.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 27 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.4 feet on 01/15/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
